As you finish the day when the memory is still fresh, the memory is still there to really harvest and solidify it in your pattern recognition skills, what you need to do is have a quiet moment at the end of the day, whether it's on your train, back home if you live in Traffic light actually I don't suggest a traffic light because you might miss the green red and white traffic light Or if you you know just before you go to bed Just have that quiet moment when you you put yourself and you meditate your entire day And the power of the brain is that you can go fast forward There is no such thing as time because you can fast forward entire 12 hours trading session within five minutes You know, so you go through you close your eyes you go through parts of the day where the market was quiet What a trade like how did you execute? What was your thinking behind those trades and and and and what was your self-talk behind those trades? Was it negative or a positive self-talk and whilst you going through the trades in your head also start mapping almost in a three-dimensional perspective because that's the part of the brain. text: And that starts becoming filed into your unconscious memory bank in your price ladder section of your brain And then the next time you're encountering that type of play or setup, your memory is able to retrieve that information and you're able to execute more and more effectively. To me this is the most important practice if you want to develop yourself. If you can do this every single day of your career you will develop such great patterns in your head and you'll always evolve with the market because you're always Re-updating your files every single day as the market alters and the market changes and you Effectively moving in this common symbiosis this mutually beneficial relationship that you're having with the market because you're evolving with it So to me, this is the most important practice you take anything away from this entire course. It's this little practice over here So as I've mentioned I've really have elaborated in this is at the end of each training session visualize the day's market movement in relation to order flow structure and place and the roots of powerful moves and you can see In on this slide you can see the picture of this man in a Zen this man or woman in a Zen state mode Meditating with the price ladder in his you know in his head as he solidifies that learning Now reconcile these moods with your execution and thought patterns. You know if you entered a trade and And the market was going and all of sudden you got scared out because you went two ticks on side and two ticks off side And you got scared out because all you're thinking was you know I haven't been performing well What's my mental thinking? What's my risk manager thinking? Are they gonna get rid of me? I'm down on account the moment you're aware of that you you starting to capture. Well none of those thoughts fit the purpose of observing the trade for the trade I'm putting unnecessary distracting thoughts in the moment you can isolate those thoughts and recognize in the next time you face or that you're able to identify this isn't productive thoughts because this doesn't accelerate my ability to put on the right and correct trade really the feedback loop on how you would execute these patterns. So you've done the memory of how you traded it. You've meditated the entire day and how you executed on the day. Then you give yourself the feedback. Well how should have I traded? Well if I had that self-talk that was negative, next time I'm going to put a trigger in saying is the self-talk positive? If not then again take a breath in Look at maybe your charts, look at the ladder, look where you're wrong, and relax and focus at the task at hand. Be present in the moment rather than looking to the future or the past, which distracts the present moment in order for you to become a really expert and genius price ladder trader. unconscious state programming and that's what you're doing it's almost a method
